name: fastmcp_qa_benchmark
description: Sample QA benchmark dataset for FastMCP evaluation

test_cases.question: What is FastMCP?
test_cases.answer: FastMCP is a Model Context Protocol server for document-aware queries with semantic search
answers: FastMCP is a Model Context Protocol server
A document-aware query assistant using MCP
FastMCP is an MCP server for semantic search and document queries

test_cases.question: What embedding model does FastMCP use?
How does semantic search work in FastMCP?
test_cases.answer: Uses pgvector with cosine distance operator for similarity search at database level

test_cases.question: Where are uploaded documents stored?
test_cases.answer: Documents are stored in Supabase with embeddings in pgvector

test_cases.question: What LLM does FastMCP use by default?
How do you add a new MCP tool to FastMCP?
What frontend framework does FastMCP use?
test_cases.answer: Next.js 14 with App Router and TypeScript

test_cases.question: How does authentication work in FastMCP?
What chunk size does FastMCP use for document processing?
What similarity threshold is used for relevant document matching?
If I upload a PDF, what steps does FastMCP take to make it searchable?
test_cases.answer: Extracts text, chunks content into 600-char segments, generates embeddings with all-MiniLM-L6-v2, stores in pgvector database

test_cases.question: What are the advantages of pgvector over in-memory similarity search?
test_cases.answer: Database-level search is faster, scales to unlimited documents, uses zero application memory, and provides sub-10ms queries
